layer.name: Sacrifice
layer.definition: Pour out for others with no expectation of return.

questions.text: Entering into others' emotional pain (feeling with them, not just advising) is ...

answers.4: common — I feel with people in their suffering
answers.5: expected — empathy means entering the pain
answers.3: moderate — I enter some people's pain
answers.1: rare — I offer advice from a distance

questions.text: Giving my emotional stability to help regulate others (even when it drains me) is ...

answers.4: common — I offer my stability freely
answers.5: expected — my calm is for sharing
answers.1: rare — I protect my emotional energy

questions.text: Absorbing emotional difficulty so others don't carry it alone is ...

answers.4: common — I regularly carry others' burdens
answers.3: moderate — I take on some weight

questions.text: Being emotionally available for others' crises (even when inconvenient) is ...

answers.5: expected — availability is part of love
answers.1: rare — I protect my emotional space

questions.text: Having invested emotionally in people who hurt me (without regret) is ...

answers.4: part of loving — I keep investing
answers.5: expected — love always risks and I accept that
answers.3: real — but it's affected how I love
answers.1: not my experience — I guard against that

remediation.advice: Emotional sacrifice means being willing to feel with others — to enter their joy and their pain, not just observe it. This costs peace, stability, and energy. If you protect yourself from all emotional investment, you're hoarding. Build reserves (Layer 6) so you can give them away.

scripture.text: Bear one another's burdens, and so fulfill the law of Christ.
